intro: Arachnis alba, commonly known as the white arachnis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, white, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture with a glossy surface. Arachnis alba is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
